description: A redhat-best-practices-for-k8s claim is an attestation of the tests performed, the results and the various configurations.  Since a claim must be reproducible, it also includes an overview of the systems under test and their physical configurations.

identifier.description: identifier is a per testcase unique identifier.

tags.description: tags stores the different tags applied to a test.

id.description: id stores a unique id for the testcase.

suite.description: suite stores the test suite name for the testcase.

result.description: result is the result of running a testcase.

failureLocation.description: The Filename and line number where the failure happened

failureLineContent.description: The content of the line where the failure happened

state.description: The test result state: INVALID SPEC STATE, pending,skipped,passed,failed,aborted,panicked,interrupted

skipReason.description: Describes the reasons for not running a test (skipped, aborted, panicked, interrupted)

checkDetails.description: Described the reasons for passing or failing a test

duration.description: The duration of the test in nanoseconds.

startTime.description: The start time of the test.

endTime.description: The end time of the test.

capturedTestOutput.description: Ginkgo writer output during the test run.

categoryClassification.description: categoryClassification is the classification for a single test case.

Extended.description: indicates whether this test case is mandatory or optional in the Extended scenario

FarEdge.description: indicates whether this test case is mandatory or optional in the FarEdge scenario

NonTelco.description: indicates whether this test case is mandatory or optional in the NonTelco scenario

Telco.description: indicates whether this test case is mandatory or optional in the Telco scenario

catalogInfo.description: test specific information from the catalog

remediation.description: steps required to fix a failing test case

exceptionProcess.description: Indicates the exception process if defined

bestPracticeReference.description: Link to the best practice document supporting this test case

startTime.description: The UTC start time of a claim evaluation.  This is recorded when the redhat-best-practices-for-k8s test suite is invoked.

endTime.description: The UTC end time of a claim evaluation.  This is recorded when the redhat-best-practices-for-k8s test suite completes.

configurations.description: Tests within redhat-best-practices-for-k8s often require configuration.  For example, the generic test suite requires listing all CNF containers.  This information is used to derive per-container IP address information, which is then used as input to the connectivity test suite.  Test suites within redhat-best-practices-for-k8s may use multiple configurations, but each with a unique name.

additionalProperties.description: Tests within redhat-best-practices-for-k8s often require configuration.  For example, the generic test suite requires listing all CNF containers.  This information is used to derive per-container IP address information, which is then used as input to the connectivity test suite.  Test suites within redhat-best-practices-for-k8s may use multiple configurations, each of which is arbitrary in structure and use case specific.

nodes.description: An OpenShift cluster is composed of an arbitrary number of Nodes used for platform and application services.  Since a claim must be reproducible, a variety of per-Node information must be collected and stored in the claim.  Node names are unique within a given OpenShift cluster.

results.description: The results for each unique test case.
